intro: Veronica rosea f. ciliatisepala, commonly known as the fringed-sepal veronica, is a botanical variant of the common veronica species. It is characterized by its distinctive fringed sepals, which give it a unique floral appearance. The plant typically features pink to purple flowers with a delicate, almost lace-like structure. It is native to regions of Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. This cultivar is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
